website_summaries.verdict: Great alternative to high-end models. Versatility is its strong suit. We wish it were induction burner-ready, but considering its price point, it's a steal.
pros: Includes pasta insert, steamer basket & lid
can go from freezer to stovetop to oven
cons: Pasta basket and colander have design issues
Thin layer of stainless steel can wear over time

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for black material to be seeping into the water
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this pot for 3 months. It doesn’t matter how many times I wash it, scrub it, soak it, etc these black streaks won’t go away. It’s like this is seeping from the holes in the strainer. And when I cook pasta in it, the black material is in the water. Not very sanitary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: RUST AFTER FIRST USE
customer_reviews.text: So dissapointing!!! I thought Cuisinart was a quality brand but the pasta insert has RUSTY SPOTS after the first and only use!! The insert looks and feels very cheaply made, thin and the holes are scratchy. I thought that's tolerable, but RUST is not. Who knows what else is leaking from this cheapo steel into the food. Yuck! Will return
customer_reviews.author: Dora

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Poor Quality Control.
customer_reviews.text: Even after washing, there is black residue in the holes of the strainer that remained. Luckily we noticed before adding pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin D Wright

customer_reviews.title: Rust
customer_reviews.text: After only a few weeks of use, the pot and strainer have started rusting. I've been very careful to wash promptly after using, so this seems like a design flaw with whatever type of steel this is made out of.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Beal

customer_reviews.title: Not induction ready as stated in the product description.
customer_reviews.text: The reason I gave this stock pot and pasta insert only 1 star wasn’t because of the item but because in the incorrect description of this set on the Amazon site. In the description said it was induction ready and unfortunately that wasn’t the case. I needed cookware that would work on my induction cooktop. This seems like a nice pan but it most definitely doesn’t work if you have an induction cooktop. I would suggest that Amazon updates the information on this item so as to help others not be inconvenienced.
customer_reviews.author: melissa myers

customer_reviews.title: NOT INDUCTION READY
customer_reviews.text: The product description says induction ready. That is the main reason I ordered this pot, to replace a non-induction ready pot for my new induction cooktop. The packaging does not include induction and a magnet does not stick to the bottom of the pot. THIS POT IS NOT INDUCTION READY. AMAZON SHOULD UPDATE THIS PRODUCTS DESCRIPTION IMMEDIATELY!
customer_reviews.author: Scott K. Parmelee

customer_reviews.title: One of My Favorite Pots
customer_reviews.text: We do a lot of cooking videos on our YouTube channel: RoseRedHomestead and we feature this pot a lot because it is gorgeous to look at and a pleasure to use. It is big! It is so handy for cooking pasta, or my favorite use is to soak a big batch of dry beans in the inner pot submerged in water in the outer pot. When soaking is finished, it is a breeze to drain and rinse the beans by just pulling up the inner pot. I have used it many times and it still washes up and shines like new. I highly recommend this pot.
customer_reviews.author: pamcan

customer_reviews.title: Great pots
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pot set to replace old ones that chipped and failed. I was surprised at the very high quality of the set and their functionality. They work great not only for pasta, but also whenever you need large pots for stews, chili, and other stuff. The main pot base is thick aluminum and transmits stove heat beautifully. Quality is immediately apparent through the pieces. Works great for steaming shrimp, lobster, clams, etc. Perhaps the only downside is that the main pot is too large to fit in our refrigerator, but contents can always be moved to smaller containers. A small price to pay for gorgeous pot ware. Well worth the price and recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Overall good buy-would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the interior has a “max fill” liquid line-decreases range top spillover! Steel is not too heavy to lift when full.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Rusty Pot
customer_reviews.text: Started to rust on the bottom of the pot where the engraving is.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Abadia

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I love Cuisanart pots and pans. They have a solid weight and durability. I love the metal handles because metal won't degrade over time and rot or break like plastic. This series costs more money but is worth it in the long run. It's not the cheapest not the most expensive cookware you can buy and I believe it's a great mid-range value.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie E

customer_reviews.title: Not induction-compatible
customer_reviews.text: The description says it's induction-ready, but my induction cooktop doesn't recognize it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph O Neeman

customer_reviews.title: FORGET ABOUT EXPENSIVE COOKWARE
customer_reviews.text: This line of Cuisinart is exquisite for cooking and looking good in the kitchen. Don't waste your money on All-Clad or Viking when you can have comparable cookware at a fraction of the cost. They have all shapes and sizes for all your cooking needs.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice pot, large capacity but some discoloration after use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stock pot! With the included insert, making broth, pasta and tamales is so much easier. The large capacity allowed for an entire large turkey carcass to be used for broth (broken down of course)! My only complaint would be the discoloration inside the pot that won't come off, but which doesn't effect the performance. It does spoil the shiny appearance of the pot I liked when I made the purchase. I still believe it is money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Liz Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: I have always found Cuisinart to be of the finest quality but after using twice this spaghetti pot shows stains on the bottom and sides. I wondered if it is a knock-off. The bottom now has a rainbow finish with little white spots and the sides have turned brown at the cooking line, and no amount of washing or wiping will remove stains. It is a huge pot and very Heavy and unwieldy when filled with water.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT work on induction cooktop
customer_reviews.text: The stockpot is great and I love the pasta insert. But my pot did NOT work when I switched to an induction cook top. Based on other reviewers having the same problem, I would say it is not a fluke or quirk of my specific stove. CHANGE THE PRODUCT DESCRIPTION, Cuisinart! This is not an induction ready stockpot.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Pulido

customer_reviews.title: Works Great-lovely set
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Pros: Good weight, fill line marked inside for pasta max, seals tight, lid fits nicely, pasta insert works wonderful, steamer is very nice with folding handles, can be stored together (I use the plastic it came in so doesn't scratch each other), handles are heavy & easy to grab, insert was a perfect size to miss my vent fan when lifting out on front burners), cleaned up easily. Works on electric stove burns just fine. Cons: Bottom main pot can be heavy when filled with all the water for pasta insert. (might be hard for some people to dump out) *Let cool before trying* I first used it to make homemade pasta in-it turned out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Renee_Ginger D

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pot for the Price & Versatile to Boot!
customer_reviews.text: This pot is perfect for stocks, soups, pasta, boiling shellfish... The shallow steamer basket is great for vegetables, dumplings, steamed shellfish... The lid fits tight to hold in the heat and steam. I've enjoyed cooking with Cuisinart pots and pans for years and, as always, very reasonably priced for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this pot.
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this on Amazon at 80% off, I couldn't resist and I'm glad I didn't. This pot is great. It's a beautiful kitchen tool and I love how easy it is to strain and steam food with the double pot and steamer. Great quality made pot and beautiful stainless steel. I would recommend this to anyone who wants one. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Wormgrunter

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this to make a pasta and I used first time, pasta is black rn. Now I have to do it with a good quality cooker because the pasta is going to trash. WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!!! All the color of this cooker is on my pasta.Unfortunately Amazon doesn't let me to add any picture!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zyksel

customer_reviews.title: This is BIG!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a large pot, and I got one! It is excellent but the size makes it slightly unwieldy: hard to fill, hard to empty, hard to manoever when washing in the sink (and I have a very large sink). That aside, it is very versatile: cook lobster, cook pasta with the insert, steam a large amount of veggies, even an eggplant, in the steamer. It's high quality, which one would expect from Cuisinart. The size is a slight negative, but this is still a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mepper

customer_reviews.title: Quality and versatility are great
customer_reviews.text: I am a chef and caterer. But I am also someone who loves to grow my own food and can it. This is probably the best pot I have right now. Have had it for several years now and still looks like new. Bottom is heavy for even heating and no scorching. I use the pasta strainer for blanching vegetables. Fantastic when canning, no losing my hot water or scooping veggies out. Definitely a time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Terri M

customer_reviews.title: Wash thoroughly - Boil empty a few times first
customer_reviews.text: The manual says to clean before using. Holy crap make sure you do. The inner strainer was still coated in the oil the must use to form and press out the holes. After three washes I was still getting small flakes off during washing. When I finally decided it was clean enough to use I found more shrapnel on my lasagna noodles and the bottom of the pan. That’s absolute bs from a name brand product.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: 12-Quart Pasta/Steamer Set
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy set which we have used on pasta and steaming foods. Feels well constructed and should last for ever. Stainless cleans up well and looks great. Very happy with how much food we can prepare at once..
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: The top steamer is nice to steam veggies or fruits (to puree or freeze)
customer_reviews.text: This pot is a kitchen staple for us. We use it at least one or twice a week. The top steamer is nice to steam veggies or fruits (to puree or freeze). The larger pasta insert works great, if you don't fill the water too full! The main pot has a "fill line" but I have a tendency to forget to turn the heat down, and I've spilled out starchy water several times. Whoops! We've also used the pot for large soups, because it is SO big. Which is something to take into consideration - it is a BIG pot, so it requires a good chunk of space to store. Not a problem, just something to note when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley F

customer_reviews.title: Beware colander
customer_reviews.text: Don't use the colander, black bits leak out from the holes. I saw the same thing in an earlier review and can confirm it is still an issue. It was only minor the first time so I tried a second use to be sure and it was a lot more obvious. It's a pity because the built-in colander and steamer were features I was really excited about, but now I'm too scared to use them on my food. I have a photo if the app would let me upload it ...
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great pan with lots of possibilities
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a pan like this for steaming shrimp. What a bonus it is when I got it and found all the other uses for it. Nice size and with 2 size steamer baskets it has endless possibilities
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because we didn't have a large enough pot to make lobster - easily fit three 1lb lobsters in, and then used the steamer basket to make steamer clams. The strainer insert is super convenient. Love it, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SKerman

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I prefer stainless and cast iron cookware. Others prefer something with flowers and non-stick coating.
customer_reviews.author: Bells

customer_reviews.title: This pot rusts!
customer_reviews.text: I blanched 1 bushel of peas. After hand washing and drying, there were large rust spots on the inside bottom of the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pasta pot.
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this as a pasta cooker, but oh my I've used it for so much more. I've steamed vegetables, cooked my potatoes and squash, even made stew in this awesome set. Very versatile, high quality, beautiful. Gone are the days of water boiling onto the stove while cooking pasta.
customer_reviews.author: MasterCoconut

customer_reviews.title: Really great pot, has cleaned up easy after every use
customer_reviews.text: Really great pot, has cleaned up easy after every use, no burns in making some pretty big amounts of soup and such. The inserts for the pasta make this thing really fun as well. Silver as heck and still easy to clean, No mars on the finish so fart after some months of use. Its become our go to stock pot over the 8 quart we used before this.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Northcote

customer_reviews.title: "The Cadillac of Soup Pots"  what my father called it
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this beautiful functional pot. I use it to make bone broth soup, just lifting the veggies and bones out with the inner strainer pot, leaving just the broth in the outer pot. Quality pot.
customer_reviews.author: Flamingo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy for its light weight. Good value
customer_reviews.text: Large enough for volume steaming. Great for steaming large crab legs as well as pasta and a meat sauce.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mantia

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot and have always wanted one. I love the way the strainer will sit at an angle within the pot and drain and then you can just reach in for the pasta. Great for making lasagna! Easy to clean. The pot is extra heavy stainless and distributes heat evenly! Great buy, don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.author: James I.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: This is made very very well. It's bigger than I thought it would be but that was my mistake for not looking closer. The one thing I really like is the insert is long enough to reach the bottom of the outer pot. It makes for a much larger basket.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: I love this pot
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot! I know it's meant to be a pasta pot but I don't make pasta in it. I use it for making bone broth. It makes it so much easier to pull out all the bones and veggies all at once instead of trying to fish it out with a large spoon or ladle. I use the steamer basket to steam veggies while the broth is cooking. I bet it would be great for pasta too, if you eat that. If there are any bone broth makers out there, you'll really love the ease of pulling out the bones in one swoop.
customer_reviews.author: moejoez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This pot is very large, but manages to fit on the burner of my incredibly small stove. I mainly use it for pasta, rice, etc. It does a great job steaming vegetables as well though. The steamer piece works well as a strainer as well, and the removable piece is very convenient rather than trying to pour pasta/rice from a burning hot pot into a strainer. It is easy to clean, but is very tall and too large for my incredibly small sink.
customer_reviews.author: Woundheir

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Stock Pot
customer_reviews.text: The stockpot and pasta basket are wonderful quality. The pot and pasta basket are quite heavy and very durable. I love that the lid to the pot is solid steel instead of glass. The steamer basket does leave something to be desired though. The quality is not nearly as nice as the stock pot, pasta basket and lid, but it's decent enough. It would be nice if the steamer basket were the same heavy quality as the rest of the set. The steamer basket could also stand to be a bit deeper. Overall I am still very pleased with this set and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Tao Jones

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous to buy this as I have a very low microwave over my stove and my previous stock pot was only an 8 quart. I wanted to leave a review because I hadn't seen one that had the exact information I was looking for before hand. The very bottom of my microwave sits exactly 13 1/2 inches above my flat top stove. This stock pot completely assembled with pasta insert, steamer and lid clears my microwave by a quarter of an inch. I am extremely happy with this purchase. The look, quality and value of this stock pot is exceptional!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for shrimp boil with family. Very nice stainless steel. Easy clean up. Have used it several times. Perfect size for family of 8
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great combination
customer_reviews.text: Lost my first on in the divorce so I got another. These are great pots and I use it often. Great for steaming seafood or cooking chili.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C. Shiflet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for our kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Made tamales for the first time using this pot. Worked perfectly. All of the extras are a big plus. Looking forward to more successful meal preps!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Love it! ❤️
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It’s perfect for canning tomatoes & more. I don’t know why I didn’t have one before now?! ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pasta or Blanching Vegetables
customer_reviews.text: I recently had to cook spaghetti for 80 people for a Valentine's dinner at church. I cooked the pasta the night before and chilled it in gallon bags. At the event all I had to do was drop the pasta in the boiling water of the steamer and it was ready in a minute. I had cooked over 20 pounds dry. I really love this steamer and will buy another. The one I borrowed from my husband's test kitchen is too large and heavy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: This steamer is very poorly made!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this steamer for my cousin, and it has only been one month, and the bottom is coming undone. I would not recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: billie wallmann

customer_reviews.title: Great Pasta pot/Steamer!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once, but it's great! A little bigger than I'd like (wish it was 10-Quart instead of 12, since it's very hard to fit in dishwasher), but that's a small criticism. Wanting a pasta pot for a long time, I bought an All-Clad version years ago. About $325... As the water started to boil, it started spurting water & steam over the side. Was simply unusable, so I immediately took it back. This Cuisanart model works perfectly, with a solid fit between steamer basket/pot and between steamer & lid. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen P.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, price high but truly a great invest. Seems durable. I love the measurements inside. Chef quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Raphael Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Most versatile pot available!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this all in one pot, large enough to meet all our needs, 2 strainer inserts, it has everything a kitchen needs!!
customer_reviews.author: flapsfisher

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot soooooo much. Best purchase if the year. Making pasta for me was never soooo much fun. But this people. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Not steel
customer_reviews.text: The pot was great to cook with on a conventional stove top. Unfortunately it was not actually stainless steel. Very disappointing that it did not work on our new induction stove top. As it is not actually stainless steel. Or of high enough quality to work on our induction stove top.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. nITZ

customer_reviews.title: A great pot with very useful accessories.
customer_reviews.text: A really good value set at the price I found it for. Heats up fast and evenly and was no problem to clean. The pasta inserts are really great. Also a great size for stock and soup cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Quazi M.

customer_reviews.title: I want to buy another one in a different size I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I wish I had one many years ago. So easy to drain pasta or veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steam and boil it does it all , pasta perfect
customer_reviews.text: If you make pasta this is the best product period I wish I would have bought one if these years ago
customer_reviews.author: JAYG

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pasta pot
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this pasta pot!! It's heavy duty sturdy and perfect for my every need. I cook pasta and potatoes in the large strainer and have used the stranger tray multiple times. If you have a microwave over your stove you might find space is a little tight. The pot is tall. I have an electric stove and the water heats quicker with the thick construction and it holds heat. Pot is easy to clean and stays shiny for open cupboard display. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: wolf_phantasy

customer_reviews.title: Metal flakes in my food
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it when I saw bits of steel flecked off into my pasta. It's a cheap and poorly made product.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pot
customer_reviews.text: Thisa is sturdy and large enough for spagetti and other foods that require space. Or you make a lot of such as soup. Ecellent product
customer_reviews.author: Elsie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and boils water fast and easy to clean. I have been wanting on of these for years and just never got around to buying one. I finally decided to order and wish I would have looked closer at the sizes as this is a huge a pot so I almost wish I had a smaller one as there are only two of us most of the time and you need a lot of water in the pot in order for the water to use the strainer but this is nothing against the pot, just my own fault for ordering too large. Guess we will save and use when company and family is over.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P Overholt

customer_reviews.title: Wash it first.
customer_reviews.text: Used on a gas stove. I noticed the black oil around the machined holes and washed it by hand with dawn dish detergent. Saw no black in the water after cooking pasta. This is the perfect pot size for pasta. Great for potatoes as well. Steam veggies at the same time. Heats up faster than my nonstick pots. Wish the handles had some coating for heat protection.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Koeller

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful & functional
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for pasta and spinach. I look forward to using it to steam crab legs.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very good pot great for low country boils to large for everyday pasta. Plate attachment on bottom has already started to show some rust. But overall worth the money
customer_reviews.author: DBDDixon

customer_reviews.title: Well made and good size.
customer_reviews.text: This pot is awesome. Pot is big and very well made. My wife tells me how much she loves it all the time. Works great for bone broth, can just pull the basket and dump that out.
customer_reviews.author: HankSteel

customer_reviews.title: So helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I new it was big but bigger than I expected. Easy to clean. Love the steam basket 😍. I have arthritis and can't lift with water and pasta just to heavy so this is wonderful to take the pasta out when the husband is out and can't help.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie

customer_reviews.title: Great value for good quality  stainless steel cookware!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality& heavy weight stainless steel. Love it & very versatile!
customer_reviews.author: "Jean Doll"

customer_reviews.title: Great Stock Pot.  Ended up ordering 3!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality stock pot. Bought for a Dirty Santa family gift and tried to win it. I didn't so I had to order another for myself and then a 3rd one for my in-laws who liked it and wanted to exchange different gift for it. Great price. Same exact set is $80 on sale at Bed Bath & Beyond. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L. Boatman

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I hoped for. It's the perfect size for my soups & stews and ideal for a large spaggetti feed. It's lighter weight then my last stockpot. And it's super easy to clean. It doesn't take long for water to boil in it either. The smaller steamer is still big enough for steaming vegetables like artichokes. And the mostly flat lid makes the whole thing easy to store. 100% satified.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and size for pasta, soups!!
customer_reviews.text: It's big, but not too big, and the versatility of the pasta basket/inside pot will make my next pasta event easier and even more delicious, as the noodles will be more evenly cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Michele's Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Its perfect for its designed use and looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: Norberto Lozada Jr.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT COOKING POT
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Perfect cooking pot. Love it. Good quality. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Grams M

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart does it again
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality. Heavy gauge stainless pot, handles, strainer, steamer. . Leave it on the stove because it looks magnificent, and you will want to use it often. Will last forever. The best I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My only ask would be for additional holes along the bottom rounded edge of the inset strainer pot for better drainage, but even
customer_reviews.text: Finally, the pasta and stock pot I've been waiting for! My only ask would be for additional holes along the bottom rounded edge of the inset strainer pot for better drainage, but even with that I'm giving five stars. I've used this for boiling pasta, steaming tamales, and cooking down an entire turkey carcass to make bone broth. Cleans up like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Library Lil'

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: It is very tall, won’t fit in my dish washer, and if you cook pasta with the filter, it take 15 minutes to get the water boiling, because there is a huge gap between bottom of the pot to the filter. But it get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Zhao Liu

customer_reviews.title: you never need another pasta pot!!!
customer_reviews.text: it is upmost quality, think, even cooking best ever! I just wish they offered a 3/4 strainer with it for lobster and crab, and a 1/2 for steaming artichokes and and whole brocolli!! hint nont and call me me jim 208-267-7883! thank you
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Love the size
customer_reviews.text: This thing has become my 'go to' for so many things I cook. Love the size, the strainer, the steamer. Amazing. Very well built!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a very large pan but perfect for pasta and absolutely great for steaming vegetables. Works perfectly on my induction cook top. If your looking for a pasta pan/steamer for an induction cook top, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Great value for great quality
customer_reviews.text: I just received this but the quality of product is so apparent and the price is just super!! Can’t wait to cook pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Eggie

customer_reviews.title: Needs a Vented Lid
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a a “see through” lid that has a steam vent. Otherwise, it’s what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Star Blazer 11

customer_reviews.title: Great pots
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I have been without a stock pot for too long and I’m glad I finally just ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: JTP

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, very big.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality item. Unfortunately, I had to return it, my fault, it was too big for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kim R

customer_reviews.title: Very large. Holds a lot of pasta and cooks ...
customer_reviews.text: Very large. Holds a lot of pasta and cooks it very well. I cannot wait to try steaming crab legs in it. I am not sure how well the smaller steamer bowl works,as the pot is very deep and the bowl is very shallow in comparison; but the pasta insert does work very well.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again. Lid on pot exploded glass everywhere. Water wasn’t even warm
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot. It is a good heavy gauge stainless steel and heats quickly. I have used it for pasta, corn on the cob, and large pots of home made soup. I haven't used the steamer basket yet, but it looks like that will be as good as the rest. The only drawback is the size, but if you are ordering a 12 quart pot you have to know it will be big. I am lucky enough to have a big pantry to store large pots and bowls, but if you are limited on space this may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma B

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great multi-purpose set up! I do everything from corn to lobsters in it!!
customer_reviews.author: Truman Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: WAAAAAY nicer than I expected it to be and such a good deal! Now when I have all the family over I no longer have to use 2 pots for chili or boiling seafood. Locally, I could not come close to this item in quality or price. Buy it, you will like it!
customer_reviews.author: april

customer_reviews.title: Have yet to use it but it's sturdy and solid
customer_reviews.text: Have yet to use it but it's sturdy and solid. I like that the bigger strainer insert goes just about to the bottom of the pot. I found a lot tend to sit about 3 inches from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Miyan

customer_reviews.title: This is very good quality and is worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is very good quality and is worth the money, probably more. The only thing I wish was that the top steaming basket had a handle that didn't clasped on top of the food, but rather on the side of the bowl. It can be tricky picking trying to grab both of the handles with steam is rolling out as they crisscross each other.
customer_reviews.author: Sand

customer_reviews.title: Pasta pot/ steamer
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful stainless steel ❤️ So we’ll made and I know this will be my dream come true when making my pasta and steamed vegs!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom for a gift. I really like that it can with the strainer. It's nice for veggies but you can use it without the pot too. Cuisinart is a great brand and I have bought many items of theirs. I wouldn't worry about the quality. It's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used for steaming Chinese buns and sweet potatoes. It does the job, but I didn't realize how big this thing was, LOL. I guess I couldn't picture what 12 quarts was. In any case, it's a bit of an overkill for my purposes, but I'm sure it will come in handy one day when I decide to steam a lobster!
customer_reviews.author: alohanoa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and a very nice piece of cookware.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this purchase. It is of good quality at a good price. I'm in the process of converting all my old cookware to Cuisinart from a pot pourri of various makers of cookware. I chose Cuisinart for my first purchase and have been adding since.
customer_reviews.author: Charger Dad

customer_reviews.title: Quality 12 qt. stockpot with inserts
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to make my tamales in...it features a deep steamer insert that is perfect for tamales. I made about 3 dozen tamales that filled up this insert. They turned out perfect. Anxious to use the smaller insert for veggies soon. The lid is stainless and fits tightly...beautiful finish on the stockpot and lid...very heavy duty, quality product...would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Tami

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful large pot
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful large pot. Well made and I expect to be able to pass in down to one of my daughters one day. For now it's mine! The insert goes deep enough that I won't have to constantly add liquid to keep a hen covered when making soup. Stainless always looks attractive in the kitchen. Cuisinart is a wonderful brand, I love all my pieces.
customer_reviews.author: KissaMewTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, beautiful pot. For the size, it is for 6 people.
customer_reviews.author: Nameless

customer_reviews.title: That it is fast heating and retains the heat.
customer_reviews.text: Love Cuisinart products. They are reliable and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Denyse Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Made well. Fair price.
customer_reviews.text: Great pan. It heats well and the basket makes it easy to get your pasta out of the pan
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love to cook and Cuisinart is definitely one of my favorite brands. Always amazing quality and this was no different.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vavra

customer_reviews.title: This is probably a good product - - however
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a good product - - however, I wanted to use it on a precision induction burner - - and could not. Therefore, I returned the product and did purchase a different brand. It would be good to note in the details on line that this cookware is NOT precision induction ready. I'm sure it is probably a great product to be utilized in alternative ways.
customer_reviews.author: ilene b.

customer_reviews.title: Rusting Pot Interior After Handful Of Usage
customer_reviews.text: Sadly after light use (a handful of times) the pot is rusting at the bottom inside of the pot. Not the exterior. Brand new haven't cooked much and the pot is going bad.
customer_reviews.author: RandyMarsh

customer_reviews.title: SS pasta pot
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I'm in love with this pasta pot! Prompt & excellent condition. AM cooking!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TLMKTC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Addition to Stainless Steel Set
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Went with another set that I purchased along with this. Would def recommend to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Thriftshop331

product_meta.title: Cuisinart 77-412 Chef's Classic Stainless 4-Piece 12-Quart Pasta/Steamer Set,Stainless Steel
product_meta.description:
This family-size 12 Quart Pasta/Steamer Set makes cooking and draining pasta easy. With handy measurement markings and an induction-ready base, dinner has never been easier. Includes a Flavor-Lock lid for healthier, steam cooking.

AMAZON.COM
Simmer that crowd-size batch of three-alarm chili or boil up enough spaghetti to feed the whole block in this 12-quart Cuisinart Chef's Classic stockpot. Made of professional quality 18/10 stainless steel that won't react with acidic foods, the pot features solid cast stainless-steel handles, a tight-fitting lid, drip-free rim, and a mirror finish that retains its brightness through dishwasher, freezer, broiler, and oven use up to 550 degrees Fahrenheit. For even, conductive heating, an aluminum disk is encapsulated between two layers of stainless steel in the base. The stockpot measures 9 inches high and 11 inches in diameter; 14-1/2 inches including handles. 

 What makes this four-piece set special is its versatility. Included is a deep pasta insert, so you can lift out and drain your cooked pasta all in one fell swoop, without needing a colander; and a steamer basket that sits in the top portion of the pot and allows you to steam broccoli, shrimp, pot stickers, and all kinds of healthy, fat-free foods. The pasta insert and pot have the same riveted stainless-steel handles, while the basket features a swinging handle that tucks out of the way when the lid is on top. Every piece is dishwasher-safe. Cuisinart covers the pot set with a limited lifetime warranty. --Ann Bieri
feature_bullets: Chef's Choice Stainless: Mirror finish. Classic looks, professional performance
Unsurpassed Heat Distribution: Aluminum encapsulated base heats quickly and spreads heat evenly. Eliminates hot spots

Stainless Steel for Professional Results: Stainless steel cooking surface does not discolor, react with food or alter flavors. Great for classic cooking techniques like slow simmers, rolling boils and reduction of liquids
Cool Grip Handle: Solid stainless steel riveted handle stays cool on the stovetop. A helper handle provides extra support and balance when lifting and pouring
Drip-Free Pouring: Rim is tapered for drip-free pouring
Flavor Lock Lid: Tight fitting cover seals in moisture and nutrients for healthier, more flavorful results, every time you cook
Dishwasher Safe: Premium stainless steel easily cleans to original brilliant finish
